content.B010:
is completely frontend (client side) application (web page). It works only with pseudo-files in browser memory.
See also at GutHub repo.

B020.I010: After you opened existing file, it becomes in-memory copy of the original file. Technically you are uploading your local file to a web page.
B020.I020: In-memory files you opened or created from scratch are NOT related to regular files out of browser.
B020.I030: To get your modified file back as regular file technically you need to download file from web page (with appropriate UI button in <spleMe/>).

I010.B010: application uses indexedDB and localStorage for better user experience. These things are similar to well known Cookies in terms of privacy.
I010.B020: <spleMe/> will try to remember your modified in-memory files and some preferences in browser storage for better user experience.

I020.B010: There are no intention to send any kind of your data to somewhere without your confirmation.
I020.B020: <spleMe/> when completely loaded is operating locally in your browser. Neither external storages, nor cross-device sync are implied, nor planned.
I020.B030: <spleMe/> uses <linkSoTest>{SO} test page</linkSoTest> to test your level when you request that.

I030.B010: DON'T rely much on browser storage to remember your modified in-memory files forever. DO SAVE BACKUPS. Browser can clean its storage.
I030.B020: Also, storage in browser can be accidentally reset in case of some errors in {APP_TITLE} itself. Because, you know: Every program has at least one bug.
